summary: The document outlines the operational procedures for meetings of a committee, including attendance, agenda setting, and document submission requirements. It emphasizes the discretion of the Chairperson in managing meetings and ensuring adequate preparation time for members.
keyFacts: The Chairperson has the discretion to call or cancel extraordinary meetings.
Meetings should not exceed 2 hours unless an extension is granted by the Chairperson.
Members are encouraged to attend at least two-thirds of the meetings held in a calendar year.
The agenda for meetings is set by the Chairperson based on issues communicated by members.
Documents for meetings should be distributed at least 36 hours in advance, with exceptions allowed for extraordinary meetings.
